result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke Kamish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Concurrent with: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke Kamish

defendant.name: Kamish, Luke

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Defendant Luke Kamish appeared by video, in custody from Oshkosh Correctional.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Luke Kamish.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  On a plea to Ct 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct 2, Court so orders. Guilty plea entered on Ct 1. Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and enters judgment of conviction.  Argument on sentencing. State confirms victim rights compliance. Statements from defendant.
Per request of counsel, 10-05-2022 plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled to 9-27-2022 at 1:15 p.m.  Defendant to appear via video zoom from Oshkosh Correctional.

ADDRESS INFO for Luke Kamish
Current: PO Box 3310, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 3157 S 47th St #8, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Per request of Atty. Beltran, zoom request for 9-07-2022 canceled and State to prepare an in-person OTP for anticipated plea and sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke Kamish appears via video from Oshkosh Correctional and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran in person.  Counsel's first appearance.  Defendant to appear via video.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with Washington County Fleet stores.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in custody on an OTP from Oshkosh Correctional and without counsel.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.  $2,000 signature bond set.  Defendant states he is serving three years in Oshkosh Correctional.  Defendant to appear via video.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
